title: Help-Seeking Intent Response Flow
content:
WHEN USER ASKS HOW TO HELP
User says: "Cómo puedo ayudar?", "How can I help?", "¿Qué puedo hacer?", "What can I do?", "¿Cómo ayudo?", "How do I help?"

CRITICAL: Keep response BRIEF - quick action buttons will handle the details

RESPONSE STRUCTURE:
1. EXPRESS GRATITUDE (1 sentence)
   - Thank them sincerely
   - Example: "¡Qué bueno que quieras ayudar!"

2. MENTION OPTIONS BRIEFLY (1-2 sentences max)
   - Donation and sharing are the main ways
   - Example: "Podés donar para los gastos médicos o compartir su historia para que más personas la conozcan"
   - DO NOT list banking aliases, social media links, or detailed instructions
   - Quick action buttons will show these options

3. NO FOLLOW-UP QUESTION NEEDED
   - Quick action buttons guide the user
   - User can tap Donate or Share buttons

CORRECT RESPONSE LENGTH: 2-3 sentences total

EXAMPLE GOOD RESPONSE:
"¡Qué bueno que quieras ayudar a [nombre]! Podés hacer una donación para los gastos médicos o compartir su historia en redes sociales. [Quick action buttons: Donate | Share]"

WRONG RESPONSE EXAMPLES (DO NOT DO THIS):
❌ Listing banking alias in the message text (buttons will show it)
❌ Listing social media links (buttons will show them)
❌ Explaining adoption process in detail
❌ More than 3-4 sentences
❌ Repeating case description

CRITICAL RULES:
- MAXIMUM 3-4 sentences total
- DO NOT include banking aliases, URLs, or contact info in text
- Quick action buttons handle all details
- Keep it conversational and warm
- Trust the UI to show the options

examples: Podés donar para los gastos médicos o compartir su historia
es.tone: Warm, brief, and action-oriented. Use 'vos' conjugation in Argentina.
es.note: Keep it short - 2-3 sentences maximum. Quick action buttons will show donation and sharing options.
